availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Graham (Jefferson County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary Crandall Graham in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, on November 20, 1827. Father of Helen Graham, Alonzo Graham, Theodosia Graham, John Graham, and Charles E. Graham. Farmer in Jefferson County in 1850. Farmer in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 241B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 1, p. 904.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 1, p. 229B-230A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, 1827-1829, Film #000817867.
"James Wallace Graham (1801-1875)," Find A Grave, Memorial #52962384, accessed March 7, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52962384.
